'''Tirin na Gilweth'''<ref group="note">The name ''Tirin na Gilweth'' only appears in ''[[Parma Eldalamberon]]'', a linguistic journal.</ref> was the great tower of [[Kortirion]] according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''. It was built by [[Ingil]] son of [[Inwë]] after his return to [[Tol Eressëa]] following the [[March of Liberation]].<ref>{{PE|13}}, "[[Heraldic Devices of Tol Erethrin]]", p. 95</ref><ref name="Ing"/>

The tower was described as being "tall and grey",<ref name="War">{{LT1|In}}, p. 25</ref> and Kortirion itself was named after it.<ref name="Ing">{{LT1|I}}, p. 16</ref>

At the foot of the tower was the dwelling of [[Meril-i-Turinqi]], the Lady of Tol Eressëa, amidst a ''[[korin]]'' of [[elms]].<ref>{{LT1|IV}}, p. 95</ref>

== Etymology ==
''Tirin na Gilweth'' is [[Gnomish]] for "Tower of Gilweth", consisting of the elements ''[[tirin]]'' ("tower") + ''[[na (Gnomish word)|na]]'' ("of the") + ''[[Gilweth]]'' (the Gnomish name of Ingil).<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=http://eldamo.org/content/words/word-3962200315.html|articlename=G. ''Tirin na Gilweth'' loc.|website=Eldamo|accessed=17 April 2022}}</ref>

The tower was also called '''''Ingil's Tirin'''''.<ref>{{LT2|I}}, p. 5</ref>

== Inspiration ==
Tirin na Gilweth might have been inspired by the great tower of [[wikipedia:Warwick Castle|Warwick Castle]] (the town of [[wikipedia:Warwick|Warwick]] being the main inspiration behind the city of Kortirion).<ref name="War"/>
